qas.question: What era is commonly known as the final phase of the Stone Age?
What event is associated with the start of farming?
What era saw an increase in metal tool use?
What era is commonly called as the final phase of the Copper Age?
What era preceded the Stone Age?
What event is associated with the start of animals?
What era saw an increase in metal animal use?
What is a progression of farming?

context: Traditionally considered the last part of the Stone Age, <a0_0><b4_0>the Neolithic<b4_0/><a0_0/> followed the terminal <a1_0><b5_0>Holocene Epipaleolithic period<b5_0/><a1_0/> and commenced with the beginning of farming, which produced the "<a2_0><b6_0>Neolithic Revolution<b6_0/><a2_0/>". It ended when metal tools became widespread (in the <a3_0><b7_0>Copper Age<b7_0/><a3_0/> or Bronze Age; or, in some geographical regions, in the Iron Age). <b8_0>The Neolithic<b8_0/> is a progression of behavioral and cultural characteristics and changes, including the use of wild and domestic crops and of domesticated animals.
